{"id":1513148224,"question_id":3706,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"2 weeks, 5 days","timestamp":1737257694,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"41 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1513148224/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Smallest Substring With Identical Characters II","memory":"22.3 MB","code":"class Solution {\npublic:\n    int minLength(string s, int numOps) { //s consists only of '0' and '1'.\n        int n = s.length();\n        vector<int> identical;\n        int i=0;\n        while(i<n) {\n            int j = i;\n            while(j<n && s[j]==s[i])\n                j++;\n            identical.push_back(j-i);\n            i=j;\n        }\n        int left = 1, right = n;\n        while(left<right) {\n            int mid = left+(right-left)/2;\n            if(checkOk(s, identical, numOps, mid))\n                right = mid;\n            else\n                left = mid+1;\n        }\n        return left;\n    }\n    bool checkOk(string& s, vector<int>& identical, int numOps, int len) {\n        if(len ==1) {\n            int count = 0;\n            for(int i=0; i<s.length(); i++)\n                count += (s[i]-'0')==(i%2);\n            if(count<=numOps)\n                return true;\n            count = 0;\n            for(int i=0; i<s.length(); i++)\n                count += (s[i]-'0')!=(i%2);\n            if(count<=numOps)\n                return true;    \n            return false;\n        };\n        int count = 0;\n        for(int i=0; i<identical.size(); i++) {\n            int x = identical[i];\n            count += ceil( (x-len)*1.0/(len+1));\n            if(count>numOps)\n                return false;\n        }\n        return true;\n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"smallest-substring-with-identical-characters-ii","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
